title: Medina Spirit Wins the Kentucky Derby
summary: The victory is a record-breaking seventh Derby win for trainer Bob Baffert. Medina Spirit took the early lead shortly after the start and then held off Mandaloun by a half-length in a thrilling stretch drive to win the 147th running of the Kentucky Derby at Churchill Downs .

title: Olympia Dukakis, Oscar-Winning 'Moonstruck' Star, Has Died
summary: Veteran of stage and screen won her Oscar in 1988, 'the year of the Dukakii,' when her cousin ran for president. Olympia Dukakis, the veteran stage and screen actress whose flair for maternal roles helped her win an Oscar as Cher's mother in the 1987 romantic comedy "Moonstruck," has died. She was 89.

title: Eli Broad, Homebuilder Who Transformed Los Angeles Cultural Institutions, Dies at 87
summary: 'Unreasonable' philanthropist deployed his fundraising and art-collecting skills to enliven his adopted hometown. After earning billions by building homes and selling annuities, Eli Broad devoted the rest of his life to making gifts to support art museums, K-12 education and biomedical research. Along the way, he developed a reputation for being brusque, impatient with critics and stubborn.

title: How Credit Cards Affect Our Brains-and Our Spending
summary: Buying with plastic doesn't just eliminate a barrier to buying. It actively encourages purchases, a study finds.. It's been known for decades that credit cards encourage spending. But why that happens still isn't entirely clear. New research offers some fresh insight into the causes-and how consumers might be manipulated in an increasingly cashless society.

title: European Soccer's Forrest Gump
summary: From Barcelona to London to Monaco, Cesc Fabregas has always found himself around geniuses, revolutionaries and trophies.. For a man who has been a professional soccer player for more than half his life, Cesc Fabregas still can't say for sure where on the field he spent most of that time.

title: Russia, China Top Agenda as Blinken Visits Ukraine, U.K.
summary: Biden's top diplomat to meet with G-7 counterparts in London, offer assurances of U.S. support in Kyiv. Security challenges posed by Russia and China will be top concerns when Secretary of State Antony Blinken meets ministers and leaders of allied countries next week in visits to London and Kyiv, according to U.S. officials.

title: New York City 'Stooping' Sparks Cottage Industry
summary: Resume Subscription. Bronwyn Tarboton says she has memorized her Manhattan neighborhood's garbage pickup schedule and can spot treasure in a pile of trash from 500 feet away.

title: Driving This 1995 Jeep Wrangler Is 'Like High-Fiving Somebody'
summary: Jonathan Baker's dream car brought him closer to his father, and draws waves from other Jeep owners. Jonathan Baker, 40, marketing director for Sid & Ann Mashburn, a renowned men's and women's clothier in Atlanta, on his 1995 Jeep Wrangler (YJ), as told to Mike Jordan.

title: Covid-19 Forced Many Unprepared Young Adults to Deal With Their Parents' Estates
summary: Sudden deaths have left millennials and others in an unfamiliar world of uninventoried assets and probate attorneys. There was no last will.

title: Photos: Driving This Jeep Feels Like Dancing
summary: Jonathan Baker shows off his 1995 Jeep Wrangler (YJ). We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Berkshire Hathaway Returns to Quarterly Profit
summary: Warren Buffett's conglomerate reported first-quarter net income of $11.7 billion, compared with a loss of $49.7 billion a year ago. Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway Inc. swung to a quarterly profit on stock-market gains and better results from its insurance business.

title: Decision Day 2021: How Teens Are Sharing College Acceptances (and Rejections) After a Rough Year
summary: College-decision posts surge on social media, but many teens post rejection videos to show the reality of college admissions. As long as there's been social media, there have been people sharing their accomplishments, to the delight or displeasure of their friends. But lately, perhaps no category of social-media brag has become more divisive than the college-acceptance post.

title: GOP's Blue-Collar Agenda Still a Work in Progress
summary: Biden outlined a vision of policies that Democrats believe working-class voters want. Republicans are considering their own blueprints.. After the November election, many Republican leaders looked at the surge of blue-collar voters into their party and concluded that their best hope for winning the next time was to cement the GOP's image as "the party of the working class.'' But Republicans haven't yet unified behind a policy platform to support that goal.

title: Why Black Homeownership Lags Badly in Minneapolis
summary: Resume Subscription. The homeownership gap between Black and white Americans has grown larger in recent years than at any time since the 1968 passage of the Fair Housing Act. In Minnesota's biggest city, the gap is more like a canyon.

title: Saudi Crown Prince's Vision for Neom, a Desert City-State, Tests His Builders
summary: Resume Subscription. RIYADH-If Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman realizes his dream, a $500 billion city-state dubbed Neom will one day rise from the desert, transforming Saudi Arabia by drawing billions of dollars in new investment as the kingdom attempts to reduce its dependence on oil before its crude reserves run dry.

title: Women Deserve Pockets
summary: At the Oscars, Youn Yuh-jung of 'Minari' wore a rare thing: a gown with pockets. But even casual clothes like jeans for girls and women often lack proper pockets-the focus of a growing outcry on social media.. Off Brand is a column that delves into trends in fashion and beauty.

title: U.S. Will Restrict Travel From India on Covid-19 Concerns
summary: The move comes as concerns mount over a record surge in coronavirus cases in India. The Biden administration will restrict travel from India beginning Tuesday, the White House said Friday, as concerns mount over a record surge in coronavirus cases there.

title: 'What the Nazis Stole From Richard Neumann (and the search to get it back)' Review: Prized Pieces With History
summary: The Worcester Art Museum exhibits paintings and sculptures on loan from the descendents of a Jewish collector whose art became a casualty of World War II.. Worcester, Mass

title: 'Mary Ellen Mark: Girlhood' Review: Twins, Teens and a Runaway Called 'Tiny'
summary: The National Museum of Women in the Arts brings together a selection of the photojournalist's celebrated portraits of children and adolescents-no boys allowed.. Washington

title: Israel Rolls Out Covid Passports to Children, Who Can't Yet Be Vaccinated
summary: Move comes as U.S. and other countries turn their attention to reopening child-centric businesses. TEL AVIV-Israel has extended its Covid-19 vaccine passport system to children who aren't yet eligible to be inoculated, allowing them to visit cinemas, restaurants and other entertainment businesses as it continues to reopen its economy.

title: A Dawn Hiking Workout Sets Up This Colorado Entrepreneur for the Day
summary: Resume Subscription. For many, the thought of waking before sunrise sounds like punishment. But throughout the pandemic, Jay Palmer thrived by hiking up Mount Sanitas near his home in Boulder, Colo. "I knew if I started the day watching the sunrise on top of that mountain, it would set my day up for success," he says.

title: Biden's Foreign Policy Takes a Back Seat to Domestic Priorities
summary: On China, Russia and elsewhere, president recasts the U.S. approach, but avoids major initiatives as he focuses energies at home. WASHINGTON-After 100 days in office, President Biden has changed the tone and direction of U.S. foreign policy, but shied away from big new initiatives or direct confrontation with adversaries as he seeks to focus on challenges at home.

title: India's Covid-19 Crisis Raises Pressure to Waive Vaccine Patents
summary: Amid widening gap in vaccinations between the rich and poor worlds, developing nations push to loosen intellectual-property restrictions on shots. The explosion of Covid-19 cases in India and other developing nations is adding momentum to a push to suspend intellectual-property restrictions on vaccines, putting pressure on Washington, other Western governments and pharmaceutical companies to do more to address the crisis.

title: U.S. Farmers Look for Government Help to Support Biden's Climate Plans
summary: Big agriculture companies tout sustainability commitments as administration targets emissions; some farmers remain wary, awaiting details. A White House goal to slash U.S. greenhouse-gas emissions hinges in part on farmers and agriculture companies changing the way they manage fields and feedlots. The farm sector says it will need the government's help to make it happen.

title: 'Eephus': A Nothing of a Name for a Perplexing Pitch
summary: A super-slow throw by star pitchers and novices has re-emerged in the pandemic-tinged baseball season, with a label of murky origins.. Linguist and lexicographer Ben Zimmer analyzes the origins of words in the news. Read previous columns here.

title: Venezuela Government Releases U.S. Oil Executives to House Arrest
summary: Employees known as the Citgo Six were sentenced to lengthy prison terms in November. A group of American oil executives held in a crowded Venezuelan prison were released to house arrest Friday, according to a person briefed on the negotiations.

title: In the Room Where It Happens-Because Someone Spoke Up for Her When She Wasn't
summary: The longtime energy executive has been serving on corporate boards for 18 years. Here, she recounts some of the people who have helped along the way.. In Personal Board of Directors, top business leaders talk about the people they turn to for advice, and how those people have shaped their perspective and helped them succeed. Previous installments from the series are here.

title: Lots of Jobs Await the Class of 2021. So Does the Competition.
Five Tech Giants Just Keep Growing
summary: Amid the pandemic, results for behemoths such as Facebook, Amazon and Microsoft have surged. If the pandemic had never happened, the tech industry's clout likely would have risen over the past year. But the economic effects of Covid-19 have catapulted the tech titans to heights few might have imagined possible a year ago.

title: Rudy Giuliani's Contacts With Former Ukrainian Officials Sought
summary: Federal investigators seek evidence related to former U.S. Ambassador to Ukraine Marie Yovanovitch and several former Kyiv officials who pushed for her ouster. Manhattan federal prosecutors are seeking to examine Rudy Giuliani's communications with an array of former Ukrainian officials, people familiar with the matter said, as investigators home in on whether the former Trump lawyer's push to remove a U.S. diplomat in Kyiv violated foreign lobbying rules.

title: Derek Chauvin Sentencing: Prosecutors Argue for More Than 15 Years
summary: Prosecutors cite aggravating factors in seeking more than guidelines recommend; defense argues George Floyd wasn't 'particularly vulnerable'. Prosecutors and the defense in the case of Derek Chauvin laid out their arguments for and against a tougher prison sentence than recommended by state guidelines for the former Minneapolis police officer who was convicted April 20 of two counts of murder and one count of manslaughter in the killing of George Floyd.

title: Deutsche Bank Ordered to Improve Money-Laundering Controls
summary: BaFin is expanding the role of a monitor it appointed in 2018 to look over implementation. BaFin, Germany's financial regulator, has ordered Deutsche Bank AG to take further steps to safeguard against money laundering, suggesting it still has found shortcomings at a bank repeatedly reprimanded for lacking proper controls.

title: D.C. Statehood Effort Stalls as Manchin Opposes Democrats' Bill
summary: West Virginia senator says he believes a constitutional amendment would be required. WASHINGTON-Sen. Joe Manchin (D., W.Va.) said Friday he didn't support legislation making the District of Columbia a state, effectively ending its shot at approval in the Senate even if Democrats were to change the chamber's rules to make it easier to pass legislation.
